etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – a heart, now highly stylized.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of the anatomical heart; its dots and curves abstracted into a compact, balanced form over time. Related side-forms like 忄 in compounds cue meanings tied to feelings, thought, or the mind.

examples.chinese: 我很关心你(我很關心你)。
examples.english: I care about you a lot.

examples.chinese: 他一时分心，犯了错误(他一時分心，犯了錯誤)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīshí fēnxīn, fàn le cuòwù.
examples.english: He got distracted for a moment and made a mistake.

examples.chinese: 放下心里的担忧，安心休息吧(放下心裡的擔憂，安心休息吧)。
examples.pinyin: Fàngxià xīnlǐ de dānyōu, ānxīn xiūxi ba.
examples.english: Let go of the worries in your heart and rest.
